assessments.status_rationale: Today’s headlines include multiple House actions and hearings, but nothing indicates introduction of a federal credit-card APR-cap bill (10% or lower) or its referral to House Financial Services (or another relevant committee).

A House hearing occurred (Jack Smith testimony), but it is not a House Financial Services (sub)committee hearing with a published title explicitly containing both "credit card" and "interest rate" (or "APR cap").
No market data in the provided bullets confirms whether the VIX closed at or above 25.00 on any trading day.
No commodity-price reporting in today’s bullets confirms Henry Hub front-month natural gas futures settling at or above $5.50/MMBtu.
No Bank of Korea policy decision (or change in the Base Rate) is referenced in today’s news bullets.
No Japan trade-statistics release is referenced, and no data is provided about Japan exports to the U.S. being down 10%+ year-over-year.
Nothing in today’s bullets indicates Meta disclosed a distinct Threads advertising metric (ad revenue, ad impressions, or ad load) in an earnings communication.

Although TikTok-related corporate structuring is in the news, there is no mention of Blue Origin filing an FCC application for a non-GEO satellite broadband system or related earth stations under new satellite-internet branding.
No state legislative enactment is mentioned concerning an explicit prohibition on internet voting for public elections.
No ClinicalTrials.gov registration or announcement is cited regarding a Phase 1 (or Phase 1/2) trial based on the Stanford-reported cartilage regrowth approach.
